entry.title: After hiccup in Monaco, Mercedes F1 success resumes
entry.summary:
But the four-time F1 champion steadily moved up and solidified his hold on third in the standings, with 108 points.

"Did I need this?" the reigning Formula One champion asked the cheering crowd after returning to the top of the podium for the first time since winning three of the first four races of the season.

entry.title: Rosberg wins Austrian F1 from Hamilton
entry.summary: Nico Rosberg drove past Lewis Hamilton at the start to win the Austrian Grand Prix on Sunday for a second successive season to close the gap in the Formula One world championship.

entry.title: Motor racing-Hamilton takes his first Monaco F1 pole
Mercedes fights for F1 title off the track, not on it
entry.summary:
"The danger is there that Mr. Mateschitz loses his passion for F1."

However, it is also an argument that must be taken seriously, given F1's intensely political nature.

While the hierarchy of F1 considers that predicament, the next round of the championship will be in Malaysia on March 29, and few will be expecting anything other than another Mercedes win.

entry.title: Rowan Atkinson sells McLaren F1 he crashed twice
entry.summary:
David Clark, boss of Taylor and Crawley and the man who originally sold Atkinson the F1, confirmed he has sold the car.

The Mr Bean star would use the F1 as his daily car and also took it on a number of tours for McLaren owners.

entry.title: Ricciardo deserved F1 penalty: Raikkonen
entry.summary: Ricciardo, who qualified fourth, had pointed to Monaco as his best shot at a first podium finish following a lacklustre start to the F1 season dogged by engine troubles.

entry.title: F1 drivers to launch fan initiative in Monaco
Mercedes fights for F1 title off the track, not on it
entry.summary:
"If we are totally dissatisfied we could contemplate an F1 exit," said Helmut Marko, the on-track point-man for Red Bull owner Dietrich Mateschitz.

The latter may have the edge given that Ferrari - the tiebreaker in all such disputes in F1 - has little appetite for a political fight at this stage.

The only thing that could keep Mercedes from running away with the Formula One title again this year lies off the track, not on it.

entry.title: F1 leader Lewis Hamilton wins Canadian Grand Prix
German Grand Prix cut from 2015 Formula One calendar
Ricciardo in love with Montreal's F1 track
F1 champions back return to refuelling
entry.summary:
MONACO (Reuters) - Formula One world champions have backed a proposed return to refuelling in 2017 if it makes cars faster and races more exciting.

Alonso added however that refuelling, as well as other moves to make cars louder and more aggressive, could be seen as a tacit admission that Formula One had made mistakes.

entry.title: F1 refuelling return depends on cost, says Wolff
entry.summary: LONDON (Reuters) - The proposed return of refuelling to Formula One in 2017 will only happen if it is affordable, according to Mercedes motorsport head Toto Wolff.

entry.title: Viva Forever: Geri Halliwell Marries F1 Boss
entry.summary: Spice Girl Geri Halliwell has married the Red Bull F1 team boss Christian Horner, with her daughter acting as one of the bridesmaids.

entry.title: Geri Halliwell Marries Formula 1 Boss in England
Patrick to F1? Haas not ruling it out
entry.summary: Haas F1 will be the first American-based team in Formula One since 1986 and will compete with Ferrari engines in a close tie-up with the Italian team.

entry.title: Motor racing-Patrick to F1? Haas not ruling it out
entry.summary:
LONDON, May 13 (Reuters) - NASCAR team co-owner Gene Haas has no desire to fuel speculation but neither will he rule out entirely the possibility of Danica Patrick racing for his new Formula One team next year.

"Don't put anything in that Danica is coming to F1," laughed the Austrian, mindful of all the stories written since Haas Formula One confirmed they would be making their grand prix debut in 2016.

"We don't want to sit there and say no to anything but the probabilities... obviously when she's in NASCAR, it's very difficult to participate in F1," said Haas of the 33-year-old who in 2013 became the first woman to take pole position for the season-opening Daytona 500.

"It would be a home run to put an American driver in an American Formula One team, but it takes a lot of alignment of the stars for that to happen."

Haas said he was aiming to make the most of "NASCAR efficiencies", buying in technology from different companies rather than doing it the traditional F1 way.

entry.title: F1 revamp on agenda at 'crucial' strategy meeting
Motor racing-F1 revamp on agenda at 'crucial' strategy meeting
entry.summary: "We know there are some things to assess. And I hope we will be able to have a good agenda and come with good proposals and decisions to submit to the F1 commission and then to the world council.

entry.title: Rosberg sets the pace in first in-season F1 test
Motor racing-Rosberg sets the pace in first in-season F1 test
entry.summary: Britain's Nick Yelloly moved from simulator to track to make his F1 test debut with Force India and completed 109 laps.

entry.title: Motor racing-F1 drivers to launch fan initiative in Monaco
entry.summary:
LONDON, May 12 (Reuters) - Formula One drivers are hoping to give more back to their fans, at a time when unfavourable comparisons are being made with other series, with a new initiative to be presented in Monaco next week.

Formula One's commercial supremo Bernie Ecclestone has been critical of social media, although Formula One has revamped its official website this season and now employs a number of staff to develop this area.

entry.title: F1 struggling to tap the female dollar
entry.summary:
Formula One has become more inclusive -- some eight percent of Williams' engineers are women -- and has come a long way from the days when the sport was sponsored by oil, beer, cigarettes and even men's magazines and prophylactics.

"As much as people say 'We really want to see a woman in F1 and it would be such a great marketing exercise', the truth is it hasn't happened," Wolff told Reuters.

entry.title: Motor racing-F1 must cut costs to bring back the buzz - Brown
entry.summary:
LONDON, May 1 (Reuters) - Formula One has lost some of its buzz, big team budgets are running out of control, sanctioning fees and ticket prices are too high and historic European races must stay on the calendar.

"The overall sponsorship economy, while we are bucking the trend, is very down in Formula One," added the former racing driver who some have tipped as a possible successor to F1 supremo Bernie Ecclestone.

entry.title: F1 must cut costs to bring back the buzz - Brown
entry.summary: They compare unfavourably to the pictures adorning the office walls of some of the historic F1 cars Brown owns -- an ex-Ayrton Senna Lotus 98T and Michael Schumacher Benetton B191 among them.

entry.title: Scheduling changes to Aust F1 GP
entry.summary:
The Albert Park event will maintain its traditional opening slot on the F1 calendar but will be pushed back to run from March 31 to April 3 as part of next year's condensed season, organisers announced on Wednesday.

Only once before has the Formula 1 Australian Grand Prix, which normally takes place in mid-March, been held in April.

The full 2016 F1 calendar has not yet been released.

entry.title: F1 technology moves into the supermarket fridge
Motor racing-F1 technology moves into the supermarket fridge
entry.summary: Williams said their aerofoil system, modelled with computation fluid dynamics and tested at their F1 factory in central England, can be attached onto each shelf to redirect the air flow.

entry.title: F1 technology moves into the supermarket fridge
entry.summary: LONDON (Reuters) - Formula One's cutting-edge aerodynamic technology is moving into the supermarket chill cabinet.

entry.title: Hamilton wins Bahrain F1, Ricciardo sixth
Hamilton wins Bahrain GP ahead of Raikkonen and Rosberg
entry.summary: Vettel looked set for a podium position until a late front wing change ended the four-time F1 champion's chances and he placed fifth behind Valtteri Bottas.

entry.title: Lewis Hamilton Wins Bahrain Grand Pix
entry.summary: With 10 laps to go the 2007 F1 champion was only eight seconds behind Rosberg, who curtly told his engineers "please don't tell me the gap anymore."

entry.title: Button out of Bahrain F1 Grand Prix
Brut? Champagne spraying just F1 fun for Hamilton
Hamilton defends his Champagne celebration after criticism
entry.summary:
Formula One champion Lewis Hamilton defended himself Thursday from the criticism surrounding his behavior at the Chinese Grand Prix, when he celebrated victory by spraying Champagne into the face of a podium hostess.

"I haven't really heard too much about it until today, so fortunately for me it's not overshadowed my week," the two-time F1 champion from Britain said.

Champagne spraying in F1 has been commonplace for a long time, with drivers often spraying each other and anyone else around them.

entry.title: Intruder Dashes Across F1 Track During Practice
Red Bull could quit F1 if Renault has no competitive engine
entry.summary: Red Bull swept the F1 driver and constructor titles from 2010-13 with Renault.

entry.title: Vettel: Ferrari still 'realistic' about Mercedes advantage
entry.summary: Mercedes had been expected to dominate the 2015 F1 season like it did last year, when the team won 16 of 19 races and Lewis Hamilton captured his second world championship.

entry.title: Ricciardo aiming for 'at least' one F1 win
Renault threatens to withdraw from Formula 1
entry.summary: If Renault pulls out of F1, or switches from engine supplier to competitor, it would put Red Bull in a difficult situation.

entry.title: Embattled Renault threatens to quit F1
entry.summary: Red Bull and Renault dominated F1 between 2010 and 2013, winning the drivers' and constructors' titles four years in a row, before Mercedes hit the front last season.

entry.title: Renault consider Formula One withdrawal
entry.summary: But he said Renault could also decide to invest further in F1, including buying a team, if it decides it wants to continue as a "credible player" in the sport.

entry.title: Renault could quit F1 or buy Toro Rosso
entry.summary: SEPANG, Malaysia (Reuters) - Renault say they are reviewing all their Formula One options, including quitting the sport or buying the Toro Rosso team, after stinging criticism of their engine.

entry.title: Renault consider Formula One withdrawal
entry.summary:
Renault is one of only four engine suppliers in F1, and Red Bull warned it could also be forced out of the sport if the French manufacturer leaves.

"I can confirm that we're looking at a lot of options, including heading out of Formula One," Abiteboul told journalists at the Malaysian Grand Prix.

entry.title: Renault consider Formula One withdrawal
Renault consider Formula One withdrawal
entry.summary: "I can confirm we are looking at a lot of options, including getting out of Formula One if it's bad for Renault's reputation," Cyril Abiteboul, managing director of Renault Sport F1, said on Friday.

entry.title: Renault consider Formula One withdrawal
entry.summary: Abiteboul also said Renault was speaking to interested parties amid reports it was considering buying an existing F1 team and becoming a race constructor again.

entry.title: How Mercedes became the dominant power in Formula 1
entry.summary: Knowing that change was coming, the Mercedes F1 team had been working with the Mercedes engine developers years ahead of the big 2014 change.

entry.title: How Mercedes became the dominant power in Formula 1
entry.summary:
Mercedes is one of only two teams in F1 to be fully owned and backed by an automaker, with Ferrari being the other.

Red Bull, the prior regnant power in F1, has been undone by a frankly poor Renault power-train.
